deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2081-05-01
Educare-Pullman B Admission Note
PATIENT: Ivory, Lori MR: 2097545 ADMIT DATE: April 30, 2081 CODE STATUS: Full ATTENDING: Aviles/Meyers PCP: Kathryn Oakley/Gricelda Ovalle
CC: chest pain
HPI: 53 y/o female with PMHx significant for CHF/diastolic dysfunction, HTN who presents with 2 day history of chest pain. Pain started yesterday AM while she was getting into her car and lasted a few minutes. She had another episode later that day while trying to climb a step ladder in her kitchen and another episode in the ER today. Each episode went away after few minute (during 3rd episode she got some NTG with relief of pain). The pain feels like a pressure. She did have some diaphoresis with each episode and on the last episode also developed some nausea. Inspiration makes the pain worse as well as sitting upright. Denies palpitations. Does have SOB with pain. No recent illness. Did have URI few weeks ago. Her activity is limited by arthritis in her knee, but she denies any CP with activity.
ER: Got ASA, Metoprolol 5mg IV x3, PE protocol CT neg.
Problems Peptic ulcer disease : positive h pylori Hypertension Menopause Obesity Depression Knee pain Palpitations Heart murmur Hyperlipidemia Anemia Congestive heart failure, diastolic dysfunction, EF 67% in 78 Bright red blood per rectum
Medications Mvi (MULTIVITAMINS) 1 TAB PO QD Enteric COATED ASA 81 MG PO QD Percocet 1 TAB PO Q4H PRN pain Ibuprofen 600 MG PO Q6H PRN pain Zestril 40MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD x 30 days Prozac 20 MG PO QD stopped taking this due to insurance issues Atenolol 50 MG PO QD Lasix 40MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QD
Allergies NKA
SOCIAL HISTORY The patient used to work as Railway Transport Operations Supervisor with Blyth Inc. Currently lives by herself. She quit smoking about ten years ago, eight to ten pack year smoking history prior to quitting. She drinks but has no history of alcohol withdrawal or seizures, says she drinks about five or six beers per. There is a previous use of cocaine in high school but no drug use currently.
FAMILY HISTORY: Aunt- MI, Positive for diabetes mellitus in her father.
ROS: General: no recent weight loss/gain, no fatigue, no fevers, chills, no change in appetite - Respiratory: no cough, no SOB, no hemoptysis, no wheezing - Cardiac: no chest pain/pressure, no palpitations - Gastrointestinal: no nausea, no vomiting, no diarrhea, no constipation, no bleeding - Neurologic: no seizures, headache, no weakness, no numbness/tingling - Musculoskeletal: B Knee pain - Urologic: No hematuria, no dysuria - Hematologic: No bruising, no bleeding
PHYSICAL EXAM VITALS: 159/93, 98.9, 78, 20, 98% Gen: awake, alert, NAD HEENT: PERRL, EOMI Neck: 1cm cervical LN on left, no thryomegally, no LAD, no bruits Oropharynx: clear, no lesions CV: RRR no murmers Pulm: CTA Bilaterally Abd: + b.s, ND, no masses, does have some tenderness over RUQ area Ext: 1 + dp pulses, no cyanosis, clubbing, or edema Neuro: moving all four extremities, MS: B knees tender on palpation
Chemistry Sodium (Stat Lab) 137 (135-145) mmol/L Potassium (Stat Lab) 3.7 (3.4-4.8) mmol/L Chloride (Stat Lab) 102 (100-108) mmol/L CO2 (Stat Lab) 28.6 (23.0-31.9) mmol/L BUN (Stat Lab) 12 (8-25) mg/dl Creatinine (Stat Lab) 0.7 (0.6-1.5) mg/dl Glucose (Stat Lab) 164 H (70-110) mg/dl
Calcium 9.2 (8.5-10.5) mg/dl Phosphorus 3.5 (2.6-4.5) mg/dl Magnesium 1.3 L (1.4-2.0) meq/L Total Protein 7.8 (6.0-8.3) g/dl Albumin 4.1 (3.3-5.0) g/dl Globulin 3.7 (2.6-4.1) g/dl Direct Bilirubin 0.1 (0-0.4) mg/dl Total Bilirubin 0.5 (0.0-1.0) mg/dl Alkaline Phosphatase 129 H (30-100) U/L Transaminase-SGPT 32 H (7-30) U/L Amylase 24 (3-100) units/L Lipase 1.7 (1.3-6.0) U/dl Transaminase-SGOT 34 H (9-32) U/L
D-Dimer (ELISA) 818 H (<500) ng/ml
Creatine Kinase Isoenzymes NEGATIVE (NEG) Troponin-I NEGATIVE (NEG)
Hematology: WBC 5.2 (4.5-11.0) th/cmm HCT 34.8 L (36.0-46.0) % HGB 12.7 (12.0-16.0) gm/dl RBC 4.20 (4.00-5.20) mil/cmm PLT 213 (150-350) th/cumm MCV 83 (80-100) fl MCH 30.2 (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc MCHC 36.5 (31.0-37.0) g/dl RDW 13.0 (11.5-14.5) % Poly 44 (40-70) % Bands 26 H (0-10) % Lymphs 20 L (22-44) % Monos 10 (4-11) % EOS 0 (0-8) % Basos 0 (0-3) % Absolute Neuts 2.29 (1.8-7.7) th/cmm Absolute Bands 1.35 th/cmm Absolute Lymphs 1.04 (1.0-4.8) th/cmm Absolute Monos 0.52 H (0.2-0.4) th/cmm Absolute EOS 0.00 L (0.1-0.3) th/cmm Absolute Basos 0.00 (0.0-0.3) th/cmm Aniso None (None) Hypo None (None) Macrocytes None (None) Microcytes None (None)
U/A UA-Specific Gravity 1.015 (1.001-1.035) UA-pH 5.0 (5.0-9.0) UA-WBC Screen NEGATIVE (NEG) UA-Nitrite NEGATIVE (NEG) UA-Albumin NEGATIVE (NEG) UA-Glucose NEGATIVE (NEG) UA-Ketones NEGATIVE (NEG) UA-Occult Blood 2+ (NEG) UA-SED-RBC 3-5 (0-2) /hpf UA-SED-WBC 0-2 (0-2) /hpf UA-SED-Bacteria NEGATIVE (NEG) /hpf Hyaline Cast 0-2 (0-5) /lpf Squamous Cells NEGATIVE (NEG) /hpf
Radiology: CXR: neg
Adenosine Stress Test 11/78 The ECG response to pharmacological stress was nondiagnostic for ischemia. The myocardial scans are within normal limits and do not demonstrate evidence of myocardial ischemia or infarction.
Echo 11/78: MITRAL VALVE There is systolic anterior motion (SAM) of the chordal apparatus which is a normal variant. mild MR. mild AI. EF is 67 %. mild TI. RVSP is 43 mmHg.
EKG: sinus at 81 bpm, no ST changes, biphasic Ts in V1/V2?, qs in III, AV2
ASSESSMENT & PLAN 53 y/o female with CHF/diastolic dysfunction, HTN who presents with 2 day history of chest pain concerning for ACS.
Chest pain-concerning for ACS given symptoms. Does have HTN, HL, past smoking hx. R/o MI with CE Cont on telemetry Cont metoprolol and titrate as BP/HR permits Stress test given history On ASA, BB, lipitor PE CT poor study but negative EtOH use-interested in quitting Cont folate, thiamine, vitamins Watch for signs of withdrawal Ativan PRN, switch to standing if needs to take it Mild transaminitis Likely from EtOH, or passive congestion If pain worsens, consider RUQ US F/u hepatitis serologies Is on Lipitor 40mg QD will leave her on this for now given CP Anemia F/u iron studies Stool guiac Depression Restarted prozac Prophylaxis Nexium Fragmin Code Full
__________________________________ Quintina Golden, MD 88097
